The Dangers of C++: How to Mitigate Them and Write Safe C++ - Assaf Tzur-El - CppCon 2025
---

C++ offers unmatched control over system resources, but this power comes with a price: undefined behavior, memory corruption, and hard-to-diagnose bugs. From raw pointer manipulation to unchecked type conversions, many of C++’s legacy features still leave developers dangerously exposed – even in modern codebases. 
 
This talk begins with a candid look at how C++’s bug-prone constructs and permissive design can lead to subtle, hard-to-diagnose issues, especially in high-stakes domains like automotive, aerospace, and medical systems. We’ll explore how undefined behavior and other low-level pitfalls compromise software quality, reliability, and maintainability.
